Key Match Events: Shaheen Shah Afridi produced a beauty hitting the timber off the 2nd delivery getting rid of debutant Tim Robinson.
The first T20I match between New Zealand and Pakistan at Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium ended in a no-result due to consistent rains.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was reduced to 5 overs game due to rain.
Babar Azam has been appointed as the white-ball captain for Pakistan after Shaheen Shah Afridi was removed from the captaincy.
Pakistan included Mohammad Aamir in playing for the first match after he decided to step down from retirement.
Pakistan named three debutants for the first T20I match including Muhammad Irfan Khan, Usman Khan, and Abrar Ahmed.
Tim Robinson made his debut for New Zealand in the first encounter.
Both teams would look to play the same XI in the 2nd match and hope to see a full match.
